forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind 18 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening wraps Downtown San Francisco in a chilly embrace, the forecast hints at a night of rain beginning after ten, shrouding the city in the promise of a wet, reflective tableau. Despite the clouds that loom over the horizon, there is a comforting glow from the city lights, creating a cozy contrast against the advancing dark. The temperatures hover near a cool 52, inching slightly upward as the hours pass, while gusty winds whisper tales of storms to come, signaling a robust change in the air. 

Looking ahead to tomorrow, expect rain to paint the city in shades of grey, transforming familiar streets into slick corridors. With a high nearing 59, the chill will settle in deeper by afternoon, making layering essential—a cardigan or a light jacket would be wise, complemented by sturdy shoes for those who dare to venture out. While the dampness may deter some, it is a perfect chance to embrace the quietude of an afternoon spent inside a local café, where the warmth of coffee can compete with the chill outside, or perhaps to delve into an art gallery, where the rainy ambiance can lend an introspective mood to the exhibits. While the fog may not blanket the city tonight, the gentle presence of a marine layer lingers just offshore, a reminder of San Francisco's ever-changing embrace with the sea. This evening promises a tender transition into a damp Wednesday, softly urging one to find comfort indoors amidst the approaching storm.
